class.name: SiONDriver
class.brief_description: Main GDSiON class for configuration and control of the synthesizer.
class.description: The driver is your main tool for controlling the GDSiON synthesizer. It exposes methods to initialize streaming or rendering of the output buffer, to get internal components and modules, and to configure high level properties. A new instance can be created using the factory method [method create]. Note, that [SiONDriver] is a node and must be added to the scene tree. [codeblocks] [gdscript] var driver := SiONDriver.create() add_child(driver) [/gdscript] [/codeblocks] Using the class constructor creates an instance with every parameter set to default, which may not be desirable. Only one driver instance can exist at the same time.

method.name: clear_data
method.description: Clears current data set previously by [method play], [method compile], or [method render]. Note that calling [method stop] during streaming does this already.

method.name: compile
method.description: Compiles the given MML string into a [SiONData] instance. This instance can then be used to render the melody out into a buffer via [method render], or to play it via [method play].

method.name: create
method.description: Creates a new instance of [SiONDriver]. Prefer using this method instead of the class constructor. Use [param buffer_size] to control the size of the generated buffer. Bigger size is more demanding on your hardware. Supported values are [code]2048[/code], [code]4096[/code], [code]8192[/code]. Use [param channel_num] to configure the number of output channels. Can only be [code]1[/code] for mono and [code]2[/code] for stereo. Use [param sample_rate] to control the sampling rate. Only [code]44100[/code] is supported at this time. Use [param bitrate] to enable quantization.

method.name: get_audio_playback
method.description: Returns the internal [AudioStreamGeneratorPlayback] instance. Only available during streaming (after calling [method play]).

method.name: get_audio_player
method.description: Returns the internal [AudioStreamPlayer] instance. The player instance can be used to change the audio bus used by the synthesizer.

method.name: get_audio_stream
method.description: Returns the internal [AudioStreamGenerator] instance.

method.name: get_bitrate
method.description: Returns the bitrate value used for quantization. See also [method create].

method.name: get_buffer_length
method.description: Returns the target size of the generated buffer. See also [method create].

method.name: get_channel_num
method.description: Returns the number of output channels. See also [method create].

method.name: get_compiling_time
method.description: Returns the time it took to perform the last compile task (including calls to [method play]).

method.name: get_data
method.description: Returns current data set previously by [method play], [method compile], or [method render].

method.name: get_effector
method.description: Returns a reference to the [SiEffector] instance. You can use it to control global effects and filters.

method.name: get_processing_time
method.description: Returns the average processing time during streaming.

method.name: get_queue_job_progress
method.description: Returns the progress of the current job item in the execution queue, as a value between [code]0.0[/code] and [code]1.0[/code].

method.name: get_queue_length
method.description: Returns the remaining size of the execution queue.

method.name: get_queue_total_progress
method.description: Returns the total progress between all jobs in the execution queue, as a value between [code]0.0[/code] and [code]1.0[/code]. The progress is calculated against the queue size at the time of the last [method start_queue] call.

method.name: get_rendering_time
method.description: Returns the time it took to perform the last render task.

method.name: get_sample_rate
method.description: Returns the sampling rate. See also [method create].

method.name: get_sequencer
method.description: Returns a reference to the [SiMMLSequencer] instance.

method.name: get_sound_chip
method.description: Returns a reference to the [SiOPMSoundChip] instance.

method.name: get_track_count
method.description: Returns the number of active tracks in the sequencer.

method.name: get_version
method.description: Returns the current version number as a string.

method.name: get_version_flavor
method.description: Returns the flavor of the current version, e.g. "stable" or "beta1".

method.name: note_off
method.description: Executes a note off event for all matching tracks (see also [method SiMMLTrack.get_track_id]). Returns affected tracks. [param delay] and [param quantize] must be in 1/16th of a beat. [b]Note:[/b] Streaming must be initialized before this method is called (see [method play]).

method.name: note_on
method.description: Executes a note on event using the given voice. Returns the affected, or newly created, track (see also [method SiMMLTrack.get_track_id]). [param length], [param delay], and [param quantize] must be in 1/16th of a beat. Use [param disposable] to control whether the track can be freed after being used. Making a track non-disposable must be treated with care as it can lead to performance penalties. [b]Note:[/b] Streaming must be initialized before this method is called (see [method play]).

method.name: pause
method.description: Pauses streaming initialized by [method play].

method.name: play
method.description: Starts streaming using the data provided, which is played immediately. Stops existing streaming, if it exists (see [method stop]). Does nothing when streaming is paused (see [method pause]). Empty data can be provided to this method to simply initialize streaming without playing anything immediately. See also [method note_on], [method note_off], [method sequence_on], and [method sequence_off]. [codeblocks] [gdscript] driver.play("t100 l8 [ ccggaag4 ffeeddc4 | [ggffeed4]2 ]2") [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: play_sound
method.description: Plays the sound for the given sample number. Returns the affected, or newly created, track (see also [method SiMMLTrack.get_track_id]). [param length], [param delay], and [param quantize] must be in 1/16th of a beat. Use [param disposable] to control whether the track can be freed after being used. Making a track non-disposable must be treated with care as it can lead to performance penalties. [b]Note:[/b] Streaming must be initialized before this method is called (see [method play]).

method.name: queue_compile
method.description: Adds a compile task to the execution queue instead of compiling immediately. See also [method compile] and [method start_queue]. Compiled data can be retrieved via the [signal compilation_finished] signal.

method.name: queue_render
method.description: Adds a render task to the execution queue instead of rendering immediately. See also [method render] and [method start_queue]. Rendered buffer can be retrieved via the [signal render_finished] signal.

method.name: render
method.description: Renders the given data into an audio buffer. The buffer can be converted into a stereo [PackedVector2Array] buffer and passed to [AudioStreamGeneratorPlayback] or saved as a wave file.

method.name: reset
method.description: Resets all available tracks in the sequencer.

method.name: resume
method.description: Resumes streaming previously paused by [method pause].

method.name: sequence_off
method.description: Stops execution of sequences for all matching tracks (see also [method SiMMLTrack.get_track_id]). Returns affected tracks. [param delay] and [param quantize] must be in 1/16th of a beat. [b]Note:[/b] Streaming must be initialized before this method is called (see [method play]).

method.name: sequence_on
method.description: Executes a sequence, or sequences, provided by the given data and using the given voice. Returns affected, or newly created, tracks (see also [method SiMMLTrack.get_track_id]). [param length], [param delay], and [param quantize] must be in 1/16th of a beat. Use [param disposable] to control whether the track can be freed after being used. Making a track non-disposable must be treated with care as it can lead to performance penalties. [b]Note:[/b] Streaming must be initialized before this method is called (see [method play]).

method.name: set_beat_callback_interval
method.description: Sets an interval for the beat track event, in 1/16ths of a beat. Only power-of-two values are allowed.

method.name: set_beat_event_enabled
method.description: Enables or disables reporting of the beat track event. Beat events are fired at a quick pace, so handling of them can become a performance bottleneck.

method.name: set_fading_event_enabled
method.description: Enables or disables reporting of the fading track event.

method.name: set_stream_event_enabled
method.description: Enables or disables reporting of the stream track event.

method.name: set_timer_interval
method.description: Sets an interval for the integrated timer, in 1/16ths of a beat. This can be used as a metronome for the purposes of synchronizing note on/off events. Setting this interval to [code]0[/code] disables the timer.

method.name: start_queue
method.description: Starts executing tasks in the execution queue. Use [param interval] to space the tasks out a bit.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops streaming initialized by [method play]. Attempts to stop gracefully if triggered while processing.

members.member: Beats per minute, or tempo, of the output. Values between [code]1[/code] and [code]4000[/code] are allowed.
Maximum number of tracks that can exist at the same time.
Base volume of the output, before fading is applied. The volume is set as a linear value between [code]0.0[/code] and [code]1[/code].

signal.name: bpm_changed
signal.description: Emitted when tempo/beats per minute changes in the sequencer. This can be triggered by a command in the parsed MML string.

signal.name: compilation_finished
signal.description: Emitted when when a compilation task, either queued via [method queue_compile] or executed immediately via [method compile], finishes. The compiled data is passed as the sole argument.

signal.name: fade_in_completed
signal.description: Emitted if the fader is used and after the fading in has finished. This signal is emitted after the [signal streaming] signal. Contains a [SiONDriver] instance, a [SiONData] instance (unless [method play] was called without data), and the streaming buffer as a byte array.

signal.name: fade_out_completed
signal.description: Emitted if the fader is used and after the fading out has finished. This signal is emitted after the [signal streaming] signal. Contains a [SiONDriver] instance, a [SiONData] instance (unless [method play] was called without data), and the streaming buffer as a byte array.

signal.name: fading
signal.description: Emitted if the fader is used and while the fading is happening. This signal is emitted after the [signal streaming] signal. Contains a [SiONDriver] instance and a [SiONData] instance (unless [method play] was called without data).

signal.name: note_off_frame
signal.description: Emitted after the note off event is triggered in the sequencer when the event trigger type is "frame" (meaning delayed dispatch). This can be triggered by a command in the parsed MML string.

signal.name: note_off_stream
signal.description: Emitted after the note off event is triggered in the sequencer when the event trigger type is "stream" (meaning immediate dispatch). This can be triggered by a command in the parsed MML string.

signal.name: note_on_frame
signal.description: Emitted after the note on event is triggered in the sequencer when the event trigger type is "frame" (meaning delayed dispatch). This can be triggered by a command in the parsed MML string.

signal.name: note_on_stream
signal.description: Emitted after the note on event is triggered in the sequencer when the event trigger type is "stream" (meaning immediate dispatch). This can be triggered by a command in the parsed MML string.

signal.name: queue_cancelled
signal.description: Emitted when the execution/rendering queue is cancelled. Contains a [SiONDriver] instance.

signal.name: queue_completed
signal.description: Emitted when the execution/rendering queue is completed. Contains a [SiONDriver] instance (with the processed MML string when compiling) and a [SiONData] instance.

signal.name: queue_executing
signal.description: Emitted when the execution/rendering queue is being processed. Contains a [SiONDriver] instance (with the processed MML string when compiling) and a [SiONData] instance (only when rendering).

signal.name: render_finished
signal.description: Emitted when when a render task, either queued via [method queue_render] or executed immediately via [method render], finishes. The rendered buffer is passed as the sole argument.

signal.name: sequence_finished
signal.description: Emitted when an individual sequence has finished during streaming. Contains a [SiONDriver] instance and a [SiONData] instance.

signal.name: stream_started
signal.description: Emitted after streaming has started. This signal is emitted before the first [signal streaming] signal. Contains a [SiONDriver] instance and a [SiONData] instance (unless [method play] was called without data).

signal.name: stream_stopped
signal.description: Emitted after streaming has stopped. Contains a [SiONDriver] instance and a [SiONData] instance (unless [method play] was called without data).

signal.name: streaming
signal.description: Emitted during streaming when a portion of the buffer is ready. Contains a [SiONDriver] instance, a [SiONData] instance (unless [method play] was called without data), and the streaming buffer as a byte array. See also [method set_stream_event_enabled].

signal.name: streaming_beat
signal.description: Emitted at regular intervals by the sequencer. See also [method set_beat_event_enabled].

signal.name: timer_interval
signal.description: Emitted at regular intervals by the internal timer. See also [method set_timer_interval].

signal.name: user_defined_event
signal.description: Emitted when a user defined event occurs.

constants.constant: Used to select the chip type automatically. See [method SiONVoice.get_mml].
Total number of available chip types.
Total number of available module types.
Total number of available pitch table types.
Triangle wave pulse generator quantized by 4 bits.
Low frequency pseudo sync pulse generator.
High frequency pseudo sync pulse generator.
FC high pass noise pulse generator.
Pitch-controllable pulse noise with OPM noise table pulse generator.
MA-3 half sine wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half sine doubled wave pulse generator.
MA-3 quarter sine doubled wave pulse generator.
MA-3 sine sped up (half phase) wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half sine doubled sped up (half phase) wave pulse generator.
MA-3 downwards saw wave with sine flattening pulse generator.
MA-3 triangle modulated sine wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half triangle modulated sine wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half triangle modulated sine doubled wave pulse generator.
MA-3 quarter triangle modulated sine doubled wave pulse generator.
MA-3 triangle modulated sine sped up (half phase) wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half triangle modulated sine doubled sped up (half phase) wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half square wave pulse generator.
MA-3 user defined wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half triangle wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half triangle doubled wave pulse generator.
MA-3 quarter triangle doubled wave pulse generator.
MA-3 triangle sped up (half phase) wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half triangle doubled sped up (half phase) wave pulse generator.
MA-3 quarter square doubled wave pulse generator.
MA-3 user defined wave pulse generator.
MA-3 upwards saw wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half upwards saw wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half upwards saw doubled wave pulse generator.
MA-3 quarter upwards saw doubled wave pulse generator.
MA-3 upwards saw sped up (half phase) wave pulse generator.
MA-3 half upwards saw doubled sped up (half phase) wave pulse generator.
MA-3 quarter square wave pulse generator.
MA-3 user defined wave pulse generator.
This and the next [code]16[/code] values are square pulse wave pulse generators.
This and the next [code]16[/code] values are square pulse wave with spike pulse generators.

This and the next [code]128[/code] values are ramp wave pulse generators. Values [code]0-4[/code] are equivalent to an upwards saw wave. Values [code]124-127[/code] are equivalent to a downwards saw wave. Value [code]64[/code] is equivalent to a triangle wave.
This and the next [code]128[/code] values are custom wave table pulse generators.
This and the next [code]128[/code] values are PCM data pulse generators.
User registered custom wave table pulse generator.
User registered PCM data pulse generator.
